docs.text: it was only a matter of time before a dilbert-esque office comedy hit the screens .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , rather than coming from dilbert creator scott adams , office space is instead based on the work of another animator , mike judge , creator of beavis and butthead and king of the hill .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in his live-action directoral debut , judge aptly spoofs corporate culture .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the story is certainly not very involved , but there is plenty of truth and humor to fill the gaps .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: peter ( ron livingston ) is a programmer working at the initech corporation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: every day in his mundane life is worse than the one before . . . in
docs.label: positive

docs.text: other words , every day is the worst day in his entire life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he's stuck in a boring job with eight different supervisors , all obsessed with administrative trivialities .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he's smitten with joanna ( jennifer aniston ) , a local waitress , but hasn't the guts to even introduce himself .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: everything has simply made him a complete , nervous wreck .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but all of that changes when , after an unintentionally over-effective visit to a hypnotherapist , peter loses all of his inhibitions .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he realizes his lifelong dream : to do absolutely nothing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he begins to blatantly disregard the nonsensical instructions of his boss , bill lumbergh ( gary cole ) , doing whatever he feels like .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: peter's friends and co-workers , samir ( ajay naidu ) and michael bolton ( david herman ) . . . no ,
docs.label: positive

docs.text: not that michael bolton , are perplexed by their friend's sudden change in attitude .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but , they have larger things to worry about : rumors about that initech is about to begin downsizing . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as bleak as much of this sounds , let me assure you that office space is a comedy , and quite a funny one .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: although it shares the same absurdist office humor of the dilbert comic strip , office space is actually based loosely on the series of milton cartoons which aired on saturday night life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: each mundane detail , taken by itself , seems completely , regrettably , plausible .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: yet , when combined into a whole , the picture which results is absolutely surreal .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ron livingston tackles his role straight-faced , and becomes much funnier because of it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his character isn't simply being a clown lampooning around the office , but rather seems possessed by a zen-like clarity .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he is operating on a higher plane , where everything suddenly makes sense , and from this vantage point , he allows the audience to smirk at the absurdities of life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: anyone who has had to deal with the inefficiencies of corporate bureaucracy , or who has ever been frustrated with the technology of modern life , will recognize many of the characters and situations in the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in fact , in addition to being wildly humorous , the film may actually prove to be cathartic .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the animated roots of office space show in the film's lack of complexity .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: most of the characters in the film can be quickly summarized by a particular personality quirk .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one employee , milton ( stephen root ) , is practically a flesh-and-blood cartoon .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , despite their simple nature , the characters still manage to be surprisingly funny .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's not required to have a corporate background to enjoy this film ( though the situations may seem exceedingly far-fetched if you are unfamiliar with just how close to reality they really are ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film is flimsy and absurd , but also very funny .
docs.label: positive
